sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: तृतीयोऽध्यायः ४ अथात आरग्वधीयमध्यायं व्याख्यास्यामः । १॥ट्री इति ह स्माह भगवानात्रेयः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: tṛtīyo'dhyāyaḥ 4 athāta āragvadhīyamadhyāyaṃ vyākhyāsyāmaḥ | 1||ṭrī iti ha smāha bhagavānātreyaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: CHAPTER THREE 4 Let us now explain the chapter called Argvadhi. 1. Tree, said the Lord Atreya

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: ि क आरग्वधः सैडगजः करञ्जो वासा गुडूची मदनं हरिद्रे । श्रयाह्नः सुराह्नः खदिरो धवश्च निम्बो विडङ्गं करवीरकत्वक्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: i ka āragvadhaḥ saiḍagajaḥ karañjo vāsā guḍūcī madanaṃ haridre | śrayāhnaḥ surāhnaḥ khadiro dhavaśca nimbo viḍaṅgaṃ karavīrakatvak
sanskrit_verses.translation: The sword of the Aargvadha, the Saidgaja, the Karanja, the Vasa, the Guduchi, the Madana, the Haridra. Shrayah, Surah, Khadira, Dhava, Nimba, Vidangam, Karaviraka bark

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: खधवश्च ग्रन्थिश्च भौर्जो लशुनः शिरीषः सलोमशो गुग्गुलुकृष्णगन्धे । फणिज्झको वत्सकसप्तपर्णौ पीलूनि कुष्ठं सुमनःप्रवालाः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: khadhavaśca granthiśca bhaurjo laśunaḥ śirīṣaḥ salomaśo guggulukṛṣṇagandhe | phaṇijjhako vatsakasaptaparṇau pīlūni kuṣṭhaṃ sumanaḥpravālāḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: Khadhava, granthi, bhourja, garlic, shirisha, salomasha, guggulu and black fragrance. Phanijjhako calf seven leaves yellow leprosy flower petals

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: वचा हरेणुस्त्रिवृता निकुम्भो भल्लातकं गैरिकमञ्जनं च । मनःशिलाले गृहधूम एला कासीसलोध्रार्जुनमुस्तसर्जाः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: vacā hareṇustrivṛtā nikumbho bhallātakaṃ gairikamañjanaṃ ca | manaḥśilāle gṛhadhūma elā kāsīsalodhrārjunamustasarjāḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: The skin is covered with green pollen, three rounds of nikumbha, bhallataka, gairika and ointment. In the rock of the mind, house smoke, ella, kasi, salodhra, arjuna and mustard seeds

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: इत्यर्धरूपैर्विहिताः षडेते गोपित्तपीताः पुनरेव पिष्टाः । सिद्धाः परं सर्षपतैलयुक्ताश्चर्णप्रदेहा भिषजा प्रयोज्याः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ityardharūpairvihitāḥ ṣaḍete gopittapītāḥ punareva piṣṭāḥ | siddhāḥ paraṃ sarṣapatailayuktāścarṇapradehā bhiṣajā prayojyāḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: Thus these six, having been prescribed in half forms, were again ground into cow’s bile and yellow. Siddhas, however, should be used as powdered herbs containing mustard oil

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: कुष्ठानि कृच्छ्राणि नवं किलासं सुरेशलुप्तं किटिभं सदगु । भगन्दराशस्यपचीं सपामां हन्युः प्रयुक्तास्त्वचिरान्नराणाम्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: kuṣṭhāni kṛcchrāṇi navaṃ kilāsaṃ sureśaluptaṃ kiṭibhaṃ sadagu | bhagandarāśasyapacīṃ sapāmāṃ hanyuḥ prayuktāstvacirānnarāṇām
sanskrit_verses.translation: Leprosy is a difficult task, and the new Kilasa is lost to the Lord of the heavens. They will soon kill the skin of men who are digested by the mass of bhaganda

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: कुष्ठं हरिद्रे सुरसं पटोलं निम्बाश्वगन्धे सुरदारुशिग्रू । ससर्षपं तुम्बुरुधान्यवन्यं चण्डां च चूर्णानि समानि कुर्यात्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: kuṣṭhaṃ haridre surasaṃ paṭolaṃ nimbāśvagandhe suradāruśigrū | sasarṣapaṃ tumburudhānyavanyaṃ caṇḍāṃ ca cūrṇāni samāni kuryāt
sanskrit_verses.translation: Leprosy, turmeric, surasa, patala, lemon, horse-smell, suradaru and shigru. Make equal powders of mustard seeds, wild grains of tumburu and chanda

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: तैस्तक्रपिष्टैः प्रथमं शरीरं तैलाक्तमुद्वर्तयितुं यतेत । तेनास्य कण्डूः पिडकाः सकोठाः कुष्ठानि शोफाश्च शमं व्रजन्ति
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: taistakrapiṣṭaiḥ prathamaṃ śarīraṃ tailāktamudvartayituṃ yateta | tenāsya kaṇḍūḥ piḍakāḥ sakoṭhāḥ kuṣṭhāni śophāśca śamaṃ vrajanti
sanskrit_verses.translation: First one should try to lift the oily body with these sugarcane pastes. This relieves his itching, sores, ulcers, leprosy and swelling

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: कुष्ठामृतासङ्गकटङ्कटेरीकासीसकम्पिल्लकमुस्तलोध्राः । सौगन्धिकं सर्जरसो विडङ्गं मनःशिलाले करवीरकत्वक् ।। १० । तैलाक्तगात्रस्य कृतानि चूर्णान्येतानि दद्यादवचूर्णनार्थम् । दद्रूः सकण्डूः किटिभानि पामा विचर्चिका चैव तथैति शान्तिम्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: kuṣṭhāmṛtāsaṅgakaṭaṅkaṭerīkāsīsakampillakamustalodhrāḥ | saugandhikaṃ sarjaraso viḍaṅgaṃ manaḥśilāle karavīrakatvak || 10 | tailāktagātrasya kṛtāni cūrṇānyetāni dadyādavacūrṇanārtham | dadrūḥ sakaṇḍūḥ kiṭibhāni pāmā vicarcikā caiva tathaiti śāntim
sanskrit_verses.translation: They are covered with leprosy, nectar, attachment, thorns, cough, coconut, mustard seeds. fragrant surgery juice, vidang, and the bark of karaviraka in the mind stone. 10. 10 . These powders made from the oil-soaked body should be given to the person to grind them. The dandruff, the itchy, the kitty, the palm, and the scythe, and so on, bring peace

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: कर मनःशिलाले मरिचानि तैलमार्कं पयः कुष्ठहरः प्रदेहः । तुत्थं विडङ्गं मरिचानि कुष्ठं लोध्रं च तद्वत् समनः शिलं स्यात्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: kara manaḥśilāle maricāni tailamārkaṃ payaḥ kuṣṭhaharaḥ pradehaḥ | tutthaṃ viḍaṅgaṃ maricāni kuṣṭhaṃ lodhraṃ ca tadvat samanaḥ śilaṃ syāt
sanskrit_verses.translation: Hands are the stone of the mind, peppers, oil, marks, milk, leprosy, and the body. Tuttha, vidang, chillies, leprosy and lodhra should be the same as the stone of Samana

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: रसाञ्जनं सप्रपुनाडबीजं युक्तं कपित्थस्य रसेन लेपः । करञ्जबीजैडगजं सकुष्ठं गोमूत्रपिष्टं च परः प्रदेहः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: rasāñjanaṃ saprapunāḍabījaṃ yuktaṃ kapitthasya rasena lepaḥ | karañjabījaiḍagajaṃ sakuṣṭhaṃ gomūtrapiṣṭaṃ ca paraḥ pradehaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: Ointment with juice of kapittha mixed with saprapunada seeds The next body is the powder of karanja seeds, jaggery, leprosy and cow urine

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: उभे हरिद्रे कुटजस्य बीजं करञ्जबीजं सुमनः प्रवालान् । त्वचं समध्यां हयमारकस्य लेपं तिलक्षारयुतं विदध्यात् ।। १४ । । ।। मनःशिला त्वक् कुटजात् सकुष्ठा सलोमशः सैडगजःकरञ्ज प्रथिश्च भौर्जः करवीरमूलं चूर्णानि साध्यानि तुषोदकेन
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ubhe haridre kuṭajasya bījaṃ karañjabījaṃ sumanaḥ pravālān | tvacaṃ samadhyāṃ hayamārakasya lepaṃ tilakṣārayutaṃ vidadhyāt || 14 | | || manaḥśilā tvak kuṭajāt sakuṣṭhā salomaśaḥ saiḍagajaḥkarañja prathiśca bhaurjaḥ karavīramūlaṃ cūrṇāni sādhyāni tuṣodakena
sanskrit_verses.translation: In both the green fields, the seeds of the kutaja, the seeds of the karanja, the flowers and the petals. Apply an ointment of horse killing mixed with sesame seeds to the skin evenly. 14. . ।। Manasshila skin from kutaja, leprosy, salomasha, saidagaja, karanja, prathi, bhourja, karavir root, powders are prepared with tushodaka

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: पलाशनिर्दाहरसेन चापि कर्षोद्धृतान्याढकसंमितेन । दवप्रलेपं प्रवदन्ति लेपमेतं परं कुष्ठनिसूदनाय
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: palāśanirdāharasena cāpi karṣoddhṛtānyāḍhakasaṃmitena | davapralepaṃ pravadanti lepametaṃ paraṃ kuṣṭhanisūdanāya
sanskrit_verses.translation: The juice of the lotus flower is also mixed with the juice of the karṣa grass. They say that this ointment is the best for the destruction of leprosy

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: ग । पर्णानि पिष्ट्वा चतुरङ्गुलस्य तक्रेण पर्णान्यथ काकमाच्याः तैलाक्तगात्रस्य नरस्य कुष्ठान्युद्वर्तयेदश्वहनच्छदैश्च
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ga | parṇāni piṣṭvā caturaṅgulasya takreṇa parṇānyatha kākamācyāḥ tailāktagātrasya narasya kuṣṭhānyudvartayedaśvahanacchadaiśca
sanskrit_verses.translation: c. The leaves should be ground with a four-fingered knife and the leaves of the crow's feet should be used to cure the leprosy of a man with an oily body

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: कोलं कुलत्थाः सुरदारुरास्नामाषातसीतैलफलानि कुष्ठम् । वचा शताह्वा यवचूर्णमम्लमुष्णानि वातामयिनां प्रदेहः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: kolaṃ kulatthāḥ suradārurāsnāmāṣātasītailaphalāni kuṣṭham | vacā śatāhvā yavacūrṇamamlamuṣṇāni vātāmayināṃ pradehaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: Cola, kulattha, wine, wood, asthma, asparagus, oil, fruits and leprosy. The skin is asparagus, barley powder, sour and hot, and the body is the source of the wind

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: आनूपमत्स्यामिषवेसवारैरुष्णैः प्रदेहः पवनापहः स्यात् । स्नेहैश्चतुर्भिर्दशमूलमिश्रैर्गन्धौषधैश्चानिलहः प्रदेहः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ānūpamatsyāmiṣavesavārairuṣṇaiḥ pradehaḥ pavanāpahaḥ syāt | snehaiścaturbhirdaśamūlamiśrairgandhauṣadhaiścānilahaḥ pradehaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: The body is relieved of the wind by the warm clothes of fish and meat. The body is made airy with four ointments mixed with ten roots and fragrant herbs

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: तक्रेण युक्तं यवचूर्णमुष्णं सक्षारमर्तिं जठरे निहन्यात् । कुष्ठं शताह्वां सवचां यवानां चूर्णं सतैलाम्लमुशन्ति वाते
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: takreṇa yuktaṃ yavacūrṇamuṣṇaṃ sakṣāramartiṃ jaṭhare nihanyāt | kuṣṭhaṃ śatāhvāṃ savacāṃ yavānāṃ cūrṇaṃ satailāmlamuśanti vāte
sanskrit_verses.translation: Hot barley powder mixed with sugar should be used to kill the stomach pain. Leprosy, asparagus, barley powder with oil and acid are rubbed in the wind

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: उभे शताह्वे मधुकं मधूकं बलां प्रियालं च कशेरुकं च । घृतं विदारीं च सितोपलां च कुर्यात् प्रदेहं पवने सरक्ते
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ubhe śatāhve madhukaṃ madhūkaṃ balāṃ priyālaṃ ca kaśerukaṃ ca | ghṛtaṃ vidārīṃ ca sitopalāṃ ca kuryāt pradehaṃ pavane sarakte
sanskrit_verses.translation: In both the centipedes, the honeycomb, the honeycomb, the strong, the priyala and the kasheruka are also used. Ghee, vidari and sitopala should be made to flow in the wind

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: रास्ना गुडूची मधुकं बले द्वे सजीवकं सर्वभकं पयश्च । घृतं च सिद्धं मधुशेषयुक्तं रक्तानिलार्तिं प्रणुदेत् प्रदेहः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: rāsnā guḍūcī madhukaṃ bale dve sajīvakaṃ sarvabhakaṃ payaśca | ghṛtaṃ ca siddhaṃ madhuśeṣayuktaṃ raktānilārtiṃ praṇudet pradehaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: Rasna, guduchi, honey, bale, two sajivakas, sarvabhaka and milk. And ghee cooked with the residue of honey should relieve the pain of red air and the body

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: वाते सरक्ते सघृतं प्रदेहो गोधूमचूर्णं छगलीपयश्च । नतोत्पलं चन्दनकुष्ठयुक्तं शिरोरुजायां सघृतं प्रदेहः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: vāte sarakte saghṛtaṃ pradeho godhūmacūrṇaṃ chagalīpayaśca | natotpalaṃ candanakuṣṭhayuktaṃ śirorujāyāṃ saghṛtaṃ pradehaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: When the wind blows, it is mixed with ghee, wheat flour and goat’s milk. Bowed lotus with sandalwood leprosy is the body with ghee for headache

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: प्रपौण्डरीकं सुरदारु कुष्ठं यष्ट्याह्वमेला कमलोत्पले च । शिरोरुजायां सघृतः प्रदेहो लोहरकापद्मकचोरकैश्च
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: prapauṇḍarīkaṃ suradāru kuṣṭhaṃ yaṣṭyāhvamelā kamalotpale ca | śirorujāyāṃ saghṛtaḥ pradeho loharakāpadmakacorakaiśca
sanskrit_verses.translation: Prapauṇḍarīka, suradāru, kuṣṭha, yaṣṭyāḥvamela, kamalā and utpala are also mentioned. In headache, the body is covered with ghee and iron, lotus and thieves

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: रास्ना हरिद्रे नलदं शताह्वे द्वे देवदारूणि सितोपला च । जीवन्तिमूलं सघृतं सतैलमालेपनं पार्श्वरुजासु कोष्णम्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: rāsnā haridre naladaṃ śatāhve dve devadārūṇi sitopalā ca | jīvantimūlaṃ saghṛtaṃ satailamālepanaṃ pārśvarujāsu koṣṇam
sanskrit_verses.translation: Rāsna, Haridra, Nalada, Śatāhvā, two devadāru trees and Sitopala trees were also planted. The root of the living is rubbed with salt and oil and warm for side pains

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: शैवालपद्मोत्पलवेत्रतुङ्गप्रपौण्डरीकाण्यमृणाललोध्रम् । प्रियङ्गुकालेयकचन्दनानि निर्वापणः स्यात् सघृतः प्रदेहः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: śaivālapadmotpalavetratuṅgaprapauṇḍarīkāṇyamṛṇālalodhram | priyaṅgukāleyakacandanāni nirvāpaṇaḥ syāt saghṛtaḥ pradehaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: There are algae, lotus, lotus, vetra, tuṅga, prapauṇḍarīka, lotus and lodhra trees. Priyangu, kaleyaka and sandalwood should be extinguished and the body should be mixed with ghee

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: सितालतावेतसपद्मकानि यष्ट्याह्वमैन्द्री नलिनानि दूर्वा । यवासमूलं कुशकाशयोश्च निर्वापणः स्याज्जलमेरका च
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: sitālatāvetasapadmakāni yaṣṭyāhvamaindrī nalināni dūrvā | yavāsamūlaṃ kuśakāśayośca nirvāpaṇaḥ syājjalamerakā ca
sanskrit_verses.translation: There are black creepers, vetas, lotuses, sticks, hvas, maindrīs, lotuses and durva trees. Barley roots and kusha grass should be extinguished and water and merka should be used

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: शैलेयमेलागुरुणी सकुष्ठे चण्डा नतं त्वक् सुरदारु रास्ना । शीतं निहन्यादचिरात् प्रदेहो विषं शिरीषस्तु ससिन्धुवारः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: śaileyamelāguruṇī sakuṣṭhe caṇḍā nataṃ tvak suradāru rāsnā | śītaṃ nihanyādacirāt pradeho viṣaṃ śirīṣastu sasindhuvāraḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: The mountains are covered with a snowflake, and the skin is covered with leprosy. The cold will soon kill the body, the poison, and the head with the sea-water

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: शिरीषलामज्जक हेमलोधैस्त्वग्दोषसंस्वेदहरः प्रघर्षः । पत्राम्बुलोध्राभयचन्दनानि शरीरदौर्गन्ध्यहरः प्रदेहः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: śirīṣalāmajjaka hemalodhaistvagdoṣasaṃsvedaharaḥ pragharṣaḥ | patrāmbulodhrābhayacandanāni śarīradaurgandhyaharaḥ pradehaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: A bath of headache and rubbing with golden lotuses relieves sweating from skin defects. Leaves, watermelon, fearless sandalwood, body odor remover, body

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: तत्र श्लोकः इहात्रिजः सिद्धतमानुवाच द्वात्रिंशतं सिद्धमहर्षिपूज्यः । सीए चूर्णप्रदेहान् विविधामयघ्नानारग्वधीये जगतो हितार्थम्
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: tatra ślokaḥ ihātrijaḥ siddhatamānuvāca dvātriṃśataṃ siddhamaharṣipūjyaḥ | sīe cūrṇapradehān vividhāmayaghnānāragvadhīye jagato hitārtham
sanskrit_verses.translation: There is a verse in this verse which Atrija, worshiped by the thirty-two Siddhas and Maharshis, spoke to the Siddhas. CA powdered bodies of various diseases and killed snakes for the welfare of the world

sanskrit_verses.sanskrit: इत्यग्निवेशकृते तन्त्रे चरकप्रतिसंस्कृते श्लोकस्थाने आरग्वधीयो नाम तृतीयोऽध्यायः
sanskrit_verses.transliteration: ityagniveśakṛte tantre carakapratisaṃskṛte ślokasthāne āragvadhīyo nāma tṛtīyo'dhyāyaḥ
sanskrit_verses.translation: This is the third chapter of the Tantras composed by Agnivesh, revised by Charaka, in the place of the verse, entitled Argvadhiyo
